body_html:
Yep, that's possible. The clang-format CLI has this command line argument:

  -lines=<string>           - <start line>:<end line> - format a range of
                              lines (both 1-based).

And in Nuclide, you can just select a range of text and format only that.
body_text:
Yep, that's possible. The clang-format CLI has this command line argument:
  -lines=<string>           - <start line>:<end line> - format a range of
                              lines (both 1-based).

And in Nuclide, you can just select a range of text and format only that.
body:
Yep, that's possible. The `clang-format` CLI has this command line argument:
```
  -lines=<string>           - <start line>:<end line> - format a range of
                              lines (both 1-based).
```

And in Nuclide, you can just select a range of text and format only that.
